speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the field.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Enter BRUTUS, DARDANIUS, CLITUS, STRATO, and VOLUMNIUS

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Come, poor remains of friends, rest on this rock.

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: Statilius show'd the torch-light, but, my lord,

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: He came not back: he is or ta'en or slain.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Sit thee down, Clitus: slaying is the word;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: It is a deed in fashion. Hark thee, Clitus.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Whispers

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: What, I, my lord? No, not for all the world.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Peace then! no words.

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: I'll rather kill myself.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hark thee, Dardanius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Whispers

speaker: DARDANIUS
text_entry: Shall I do such a deed?

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: O Dardanius!

speaker: DARDANIUS
text_entry: O Clitus!

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: What ill request did Brutus make to thee?

speaker: DARDANIUS
text_entry: To kill him, Clitus. Look, he meditates.

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: Now is that noble vessel full of grief,

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: That it runs over even at his eyes.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Come hither, good Volumnius; list a word.

speaker: VOLUMNIUS
text_entry: What says my lord?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Why, this, Volumnius:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: The ghost of Caesar hath appear'd to me

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Two several times by night; at Sardis once,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And, this last night, here in Philippi fields:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I know my hour is come.

speaker: VOLUMNIUS
text_entry: Not so, my lord.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Nay, I am sure it is, Volumnius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Thou seest the world, Volumnius, how it goes;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Our enemies have beat us to the pit:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Low alarums

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: It is more worthy to leap in ourselves,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Than tarry till they push us. Good Volumnius,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Thou know'st that we two went to school together:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Even for that our love of old, I prithee,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hold thou my sword-hilts, whilst I run on it.

speaker: VOLUMNIUS
text_entry: That's not an office for a friend, my lord.

speaker: VOLUMNIUS
text_entry: Alarum still

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: Fly, fly, my lord; there is no tarrying here.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Farewell to you; and you; and you, Volumnius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Strato, thou hast been all this while asleep;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Farewell to thee too, Strato. Countrymen,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: My heart doth joy that yet in all my life

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I found no man but he was true to me.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I shall have glory by this losing day

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: More than Octavius and Mark Antony

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: By this vile conquest shall attain unto.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: So fare you well at once; for Brutus' tongue

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hath almost ended his life's history:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Night hangs upon mine eyes; my bones would rest,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: That have but labour'd to attain this hour.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Alarum. Cry within, 'Fly, fly, fly!'

speaker: CLITUS
text_entry: Fly, my lord, fly.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hence! I will follow.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Exeunt CLITUS, DARDANIUS, and VOLUMNIUS

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I prithee, Strato, stay thou by thy lord:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Thou art a fellow of a good respect;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Thy life hath had some smatch of honour in it:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hold then my sword, and turn away thy face,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: While I do run upon it. Wilt thou, Strato?

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: Give me your hand first. Fare you well, my lord.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Farewell, good Strato.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Runs on his sword

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Caesar, now be still:

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I kill'd not thee with half so good a will.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Dies

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Alarum. Retreat. Enter OCTAVIUS, ANTONY, MESSALA, LUCILIUS, and the army

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: What man is that?

speaker: MESSALA
text_entry: My master's man. Strato, where is thy master?

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: Free from the bondage you are in, Messala:

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: The conquerors can but make a fire of him;

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: For Brutus only overcame himself,

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: And no man else hath honour by his death.

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: So Brutus should be found. I thank thee, Brutus,

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: That thou hast proved Lucilius' saying true.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: All that served Brutus, I will entertain them.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Fellow, wilt thou bestow thy time with me?

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: Ay, if Messala will prefer me to you.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Do so, good Messala.

speaker: MESSALA
text_entry: How died my master, Strato?

speaker: STRATO
text_entry: I held the sword, and he did run on it.

speaker: MESSALA
text_entry: Octavius, then take him to follow thee,

speaker: MESSALA
text_entry: That did the latest service to my master.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: This was the noblest Roman of them all:

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: All the conspirators save only he

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: Did that they did in envy of great Caesar;

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: He only, in a general honest thought

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: And common good to all, made one of them.

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: His life was gentle, and the elements

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: So mix'd in him that Nature might stand up

speaker: ANTONY
text_entry: And say to all the world 'This was a man!'

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: According to his virtue let us use him,

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: With all respect and rites of burial.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Within my tent his bones to-night shall lie,

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Most like a soldier, order'd honourably.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: So call the field to rest; and let's away,

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: To part the glories of this happy day.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
